sentences.english: March breeze, danced the light of the sleeve, the more water, mountains, charming coming.
sentences.chinese: 三月的微風，舞着輕盈的衣袖，穿山越水，旖旎而來。

sentences.english: He pulled my sleeve, attracted my attention in this way.
sentences.chinese: 他扯了扯我的衣袖以引起我的注意。

sentences.english: Let work of gusset, the cloud son laughs and adore to meet of summarize period.
sentences.chinese: 放下衣袖，煙兒微笑着，珍惜相見的短暫時光。

sentences.english: You can knit up that sleeve if you gather the stitches carefully.
sentences.chinese: 你要是小心收針就能織補好那個衣袖。

sentences.english: She sewed up the rip in his sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 她縫好了他衣袖上的裂口。

sentences.english: Thereupon the emperor hid the young falcon inside his sleeve, thinking to quickly send Weizheng off on some pretext.
sentences.chinese: 於是把小鷹藏在衣袖裏，準備早點兒打發魏徵走。

sentences.english: They write the name on their gusset and keep it for a week.
sentences.chinese: 他們把名字寫在衣袖上，並穿一個星期。

sentences.english: The river Zhi orchid grasped Li Sao's gusset a while.
sentences.chinese: 江芷蘭一下子抓了李嫂的衣袖。

sentences.english: She trimmed the sleeves wth lace.
The farmer tried to shake off the wasps that were hanging to his coat sleeves.
sentences.chinese: 那個農民試圖抖掉附在他衣袖上的黃蜂。

sentences.english: He put it into his vest pocket, threw off his coat and pulled up his shirt sleeves.
sentences.chinese: 他將花放進口袋，迅速脫下大衣，挽起了襯衣袖。

sentences.english: And we intend to roll up our sleeves and work with you to try to make that potential real.
sentences.chinese: 我們願意挽起衣袖，同你們一起努力發掘它的潛能。

sentences.english: One little girl tugged at my sleeve.
sentences.chinese: 一個小姑娘扯了扯我的衣袖。

sentences.english: Wide sleeves, tears stream down from a stroke.
sentences.chinese: 寬大的衣袖，從此淚流不幹。

sentences.english: He flashed the knife, which he held open in his hand, in the light of the lantern.
sentences.chinese: 他把藏在衣袖裏的刀子拿出來在路燈光下亮了一下。

definition: the front piece(s) of a Chinese jacket/lapel
corner of the lower hem of a jacket etc
delicate hands/woman's tender and soft hands
